title: Ticket #5801: Master crashes after shared_port restart
description:
The master will crash immediately after it restarts the shared port daemon.

Immediately after restarting a daemon, the master sends an update of its ad to the collector. As part of the sinful rewriting code in ConvertDefaultIPToSocketIP(), it calls daemonCore->InfoCommandSinfulString() to fetch its sinful string. This method returns NULL for a short time after the shared port restarts, which the caller isn't expecting. We can change ConvertDefaultIPToSocketIP() to skip rewriting in this case.

With this fix, the master no longer crashes. But for a short period after the shared port restart, if the master gets a reconfig, its ad in the collector and its address file will have no useful sinful strings. Within a minute, it recovers from this state.
